trans-unit.source: Indicates that a class can use a markup extension to provide a value, and references a handler to use for markup extension set operations.

Default implementation for a XAML object writer uses CLR reflection and this CLR attribute to determine if there is an intentional callback for markup extension usages that set values of a type or member.

For example, a <xref:System.Xaml.XamlServices> load or parse, or a <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader> / <xref:System.Xaml.XamlObjectWriter> sequence, will use this attribute and invoke the named callback as part of the operation whenever writing the object node based on a markup extension usage.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Markup.XamlSetMarkupExtensionAttribute"></xref> class.

The method referenced by name through the `xamlSetMarkupExtensionHandler` value should be based on a generic <xref:System.EventHandler%601> delegate with <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XamlSetMarkupExtensionEventArgs> event data constraint.
The name of the handler to use for markup extension set operations.
Gets the name of the handler to use for markup extension set operations.
The handler should be based on a generic <xref:System.EventHandler%601> delegate with <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XamlSetMarkupExtensionEventArgs> event data constraint.
The name of the handler to use for markup extension set operations.
